Constructor Detail

JavaSystemCaller.WindowsExecEnvFactory

public JavaSystemCaller.WindowsExecEnvFactory(java.lang.String aCommand,
                                              java.lang.String... someParameters)
Builds an execution environment for a Windows system command to be played.
Any command not from windows will be translated in its windows equivalent if possible.

Parameters:
aCommand - system command to be executed (must not be null or empty)
someParameters - parameters of the command (must not be null or empty)

Builds the right Shell for the current OS.
Allow for independent platform execution.

right shell, NEVER NULL

createCommandLine

public java.lang.String createCommandLine()
Description copied from class: JavaSystemCaller.ExecEnvironmentFactory
Builds the right command line for the current OS.
Means that a command might be translated, if it does not fit the right OS ('dir' => 'ls' on unix)

Specified by:
createCommandLine in class JavaSystemCaller.ExecEnvironmentFactory
Returns:
right complete command line, with parameters added (NEVER NULL)
See Also:
